register.title: Profile
register.description: This register defines how the product is seen by the hosts: USB or BLE profile, primary interface, primary communication protocol. It implicitly activates either [Operating mode](../../../Introduction/Operating_Modes).

field.title: Network operation
field.name: Network
field.remark: If the product has no network interface, these bits are ignored.

option.title: SpringProx Legacy mode, Serial or CDC
Smart Reader mode, Serial or CDC
ST UHF reader host protocol, Serial or CDC
NXP NFC Cockpit host protocol, Serial or CDC

register.title: USB options
register.description: Control various options related to the USB interface.
register.remark: If the product has no USB interface, this register is ignored.

option.title: USB is disabled, all the other settings are ignored
The actual serial number of the product is provided in the USB descriptor
A constant serial number is provided in the USB descriptor

field.title: On USB bus reset event, does the product fully reset?
field.name: Reset on bus reset
field.remark: Standard behaviour is no, but this does help putting back a battery-powered or externaly-powered product that was connected through Bluetooth or Network to the 'ready for USB operation' state

field.title: On USB bus resume event, does the product fully reset?
field.name: Reset on bus resume
field.remark: Standard behaviour is no, but this does help putting back a battery-powered or externaly-powered product that was connected through Bluetooth or Network to the 'ready for USB operation' state

field.title: Disable SpringCore direct as secondary USB interface.
field.name: No Direct
field.remark: If [Primary profile](Profile) is set to `0` (SpringCore Direct only), this setting is ignored.

option.title: SpringCore Direct is announced in the USB profile
SpringCore Direct is not announced in the USB profile

field.title: Behaviour of the product when USB VBUS is lost and the product is not allowed to keep running
field.name: VBUS down stop action

field.title: Behaviour of the product when USB VBUS is lost
field.name: VBUS down behaviour

option.title: Keep running (either on external power or battery)

register.title: Profile addons
register.description: Control various options related to the current profile.

field.title: Enable HID Ringer addon used by Telephony services (experimental).
field.name: Enable Ringer

register.title: Trace level
register.remark: This register is available only in debug builds of the firmware.

register.title: Trace options
register.remark: This register is available only in debug builds of the firmware.

option.title: Use dedicated serial line for traces (if some)
Send traces to main serial line

register.title: Deferred commands
register.remark: This register is available only in debug builds of the firmware.

register.title: Application name
register.description: This register is available to store the name of application or to identify the integrator who has loaded its license in the product. See the [license cryptogram](License_cryptogram) paragraph for details.

register.title: Network options
register.description: Control various options related to the Network interface.
register.remark: If the product has no Network interface, this register is ignored.

option.title: Network is disabled, all the other settings are ignored

field.title: Link speed
field.name: Link speed
field.remark: This setting is only effective if Auto-negotiation is disabled

register.title: Ports of the various network services

field.title: Port of the Telnet server
field.name: Telnet
field.remark: If set to 0000, defaults to 23. UDP only.

field.title: Port of the NDDU server
field.name: NDDU
field.remark: If set to 0000, defaults to 3999. UDP only.

field.title: Port of the Direct server
field.name: DirectD
field.remark: If set to 0000, defaults to 3978. Could be either UDP or TCP depending on the configuration.

field.title: Port of the CCID server
field.name: CCID
field.remark: If set to 0000, defaults to 3999. Could be either UDP or TCP depending on the configuration.

field.title: Port for SCRDR or JSON Smart Reader communication
field.name: SCRDR
field.remark: If set to 0000, defaults to 4000. Could be either UDP or TCP depending on the configuration.

field.title: Port of the MQTT server
field.name: MQTT
field.remark: If set to 0000, defaults to 1883 for plain (unsecure) communication and 8883 for TLS (secure) communication. TCP only.

field.title: Port of the HTTP server
field.name: HTTP
field.remark: If set to 0000, defaults to 80. TCP only.

node.title: Configuration of the product as an MQTT client

register.title: MQTT Broker address or name
register.description: MQTT server IP address or FQDN

register.title: Options for MQTTS connection (MQTT over TLS)

field.title: How is the verification of the Server's certificate performed?
field.name: Server exact

option.title: Public key only - Another certificate could be accepted, provided that it belongs to the same key
Exact - The certificate exposed by the Server shall be exactly the one known by the product

field.title: How to handle the Server's certificate
field.name: Server trust

field.title: Enable or disable verification of the CN (Server Name) in the Server's certificate
field.name: Verify CN

option.title: Accept any CN in the Server's certificate
Verify that the CN in the Server's certificate matches its Server Name

field.title: Enable or disable SNI (Server Name Indication) in TLS handshake
field.name: Use SNI

option.title: TLS is disabled (all other settings in this register are ignored)

field.title: Index of the CA's or Server's certificate
field.name: Index

field.title: Enable or disable the Client Authentication
field.name: Enabled

field.title: Index of the Client's certificate
field.name: Index
field.remark: The certificat must match the private key stored defined in byte 3

field.title: Which Secure Elements contains the Client's private key
field.name: SE

option.title: Raw (private key is stored in the NVM - DO NOT USE)

field.title: Index of the Client's private key
field.name: Index

option.title: Key at index `A` (ATECC: key associated to Certificate `A`)
Key at index `B` (ATECC: key associated to Certificate `B`)
Key at index `C` (ATECC: key associated to Certificate `C`)
Key at index `D` (ATECC: key associated to Certificate `D`)

field.title: Chain the CA certificate with the client certificate
field.name: Chaining

option.title: Don't chain CA certicate with client certificate
Chain CA certificate with client certificate

field.title: Index of the Client CA certificate
field.name: Index

register.title: Options for the MQTT client
register.remark: For AWS, value shall be set to `5614030A1E1E`

field.title: Shall we create the topics before subscribing to them?
field.name: Create before subscribe

field.title: Does the server accept a Last Will Message?
field.name: Last Will Message

field.title: Does the server accept Retained Messages?
field.name: Retained Messages

field.title: Connection timeout
field.name: Connection timeout
field.remark: Timeout when connecting to the server, in seconds

field.title: Response timeout
field.name: Response timeout
field.remark: Timeout when waiting for a response from the server, in seconds

field.title: Keep alive interval
field.name: Keep alive interval
field.remark: Interval between PINGREQ/PINGRES, in seconds

field.title: Status publish interval
field.name: Status publish interval
field.remark: Interval between publications in the `status` topic, in seconds

field.title: Reconnect interval
field.name: Reconnect interval
field.remark: Interval before reconnecting to the server if the connection is lost, in seconds

register.title: MQTT user Login name
register.description: Login to get authenticated onto the MQTT server

register.title: MQTT user Password
register.description: Password to get authenticated onto the MQTT server

register.title: MQTT Client ID
register.description: ID of the MQTT client
register.remark: If this register is not set, the ClientID defaults to the [Serial Number](../../Constants/Main/Serial_Number)

register.title: MQTT Topic prefix
register.description: Prefix for all MQTT topics

register.title: MQTT Device ID
register.description: Device ID in the topics and in the data
register.remark: If this register is not set, the Device ID in the topics defaults to the [Serial Number](../../Constants/Main/Serial_Number)

node.title: Configuration of the product as an HTTP client

register.title: HTTP server address or name
register.description: HTTP server IP address or FQDN

register.title: Query path
register.description: Base URL of this service

field.title: Number of seconds after which the connection is reported as gone.
field.name: timeout
field.remark: If this register is not set (or set to 00), the default value is 30s

field.title: Number of seconds after which the product will send a keep-alive frame to the server
field.name: Keep alive
field.remark: If this register is not set (or set to 00), the default value is 60s

register.title: HMAC key
register.description: HMAC key used for authentication

register.title: Global UI options
register.description: This register control global UI behaviour.

register.title: Options for the main 4-LED ramp
register.description: For products that have a set of 4 LEDs as primary user interface, this register control their behaviour.
register.remark: This register is ignored if the product's primary UI is an [RGB LED](RGB_LED).

register.title: Settings for the main RGB LED(s)
register.description: For products that have a RGB LED (or a set of RGB LEDs) as primary user interface, this register defines its color and behaviour.

field.title: Color of the RGB LED(s) when the product is active, waiting for a card
field.name: Color

field.title: State of the RGB LED(s) when the product is active, waiting for a card
field.name: State

field.title: Color of the RGB LED(s) when the product is inactive
field.name: Color

field.title: State of the RGB LED(s) when the product is inactive
field.name: State

register.title: Light level for the main RGB LED(s)
register.description: For products that have a RGB LED (or a set of RGB LEDs) as primary user interface, this register control the light level.

field.title: Light level when active
field.name: Full-level luminosity
field.remark: Value is in percent (0-100%). Default is 100%.

field.title: Light level when idle
field.name: Dimmed-level luminosity
field.remark: Value is in percent (0-100%). Default is 75%.

field.title: Delay before switching to dimmed-level luminosity.
field.name: Dimm after
field.remark: Value is in seconds. Default is 10s. Set to 0 to prevent dimming the light.

register.title: Options for the auxiliary LEDs
register.description: For products that have auxiliary LEDs (for instance to show the state of the Bluetooth connection or the battery level), this register control their behaviour.
register.remark: This register is ignored if the product does not have any auxiliary LED.

register.title: Sound options
register.description: Options for the single-tone beeper (aka buzzer) or volume for the enhanced sound driver.
register.remark: This register is ignored if the product does not have a buzzer nor an enhanced sound driver.

field.title: Control whether the product is allowed to beep or define the Volume level. Set to 0 to disable sound. The maximum volume level depends on the product type.
field.name: Volume

register.title: Product Specific
register.description: Custom UI options for specific products.

register.title: Theme selection
register.description: Select which them to use for the UI .

node.title: Configuration for Smart Reader operation
node.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

register.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4
register.title: Smart Reader features
register.description: Key settings for Smart Reader operation

field.title: Insert / Remove
field.name: Insert Remove
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: The Smart Reader sends the Tag read event only
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: The Smart Reader sends the Tag inserted event when the tag arrives, and the Tag removed event when it has leaved
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

field.title: Explicit activation
field.name: Explicit activation
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: Smart Reader operation is activated automatically as soon as a host is connected
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: Smart Reader operation has to be activated explicitly by a command from the host
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

field.title: Activate on startup
field.name: Activate on startup
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: Smart Reader operation has to be activated
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: Smart Reader operation is activated as soon as the product starts up
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

field.title: Output protocol over a serial link
field.name: Protocol
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4
field.remark: Select MK1 for compatibility with earlier K663/RDR, S663/RDR etc.

option.title: TLV
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: SCRDR
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: JSON
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: MK1
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

field.title: Output protocol over a Bluetooth link
field.name: Protocol
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4
field.remark: Select TLV for operation with SpringCard's iOS and Android reference applications.

option.title: TLV
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: SCRDR
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: JSON
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: MK1
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

field.title: Output format over a Network link
field.name: Protocol
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4
field.remark: Select JSON for operation over a MQTT connection. Legacy IWM2 is allowed only for HTTP client.

option.title: TLV
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: SCRDR
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: JSON
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: MK1
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: Legacy IWM2
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

field.title: Output format over a USB link
field.name: Protocol
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4
field.remark: Select TLV for operation with SpringCard Companion.

option.title: TLV
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: SCRDR
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: JSON
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: MK1
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

register.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4
register.title: Smart Reader timings
register.description: Key timings for Smart Reader operation
register.remark: All the timings are specified in tenth of seconds. Normal values go from 1 (100ms) to 254 (25.4s). Value 0 stands for as quickly as possible.

field.title: Delay between 2 consecutive readings
field.name: Read interval
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4
field.remark: Value is specified in 10th of second. Increase this value if the host is too slow to process 2 Tags in a raw.

field.title: Delay before reading the same Tag again
field.name: Repeat interval
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4
field.remark: Value is specified in 10th of second. Set this value to 255 to force a Tag removal before repeating the same Tag.

register.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)
register.title: Keyboard layout
register.description: Defines the layout of the keyboard when the product runs in keyboard-emulation mode (HID over USB or HID over BLE).

field.title: Keyboard layout
field.name: Keyboard layout
field.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)
field.description: Defines the layout of the keyboard when the product runs in keyboard-emulation mode (HID over USB or HID over BLE).

option.title: US, QWERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: French, AZERTY, complete (with num. padd)
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: German, QWERTZ
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: French, AZERTY, laptop (no num. padd)
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: English (extended), QWERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: French (extended), AZERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: German (extended), QWERTZ
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: Spanish (extended), QWERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: Italian (extended), QWERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: Japanese (extended), QWERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: Swedish (extended), QWERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: Polish (extended), QWERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: US (extended), QWERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

register.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)
register.title: Misc. options when running in keyboard mode

field.title: How are the slot numbers created
field.name: interval between two identical character
field.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: none
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: 2x typing speed
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: 3x typing speed
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: 4x typing speed
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

field.title: delay between 2 characters (5ms unit)
field.name: Typing speed
field.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

register.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)
register.title: Prefix: string sent before the data in keyboard mode

field.title: Prefix: string sent before the data in keyboard mode
field.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

register.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)
register.title: Suffix: string sent after the data in keyboard mode

field.title: Suffix: string sent after the data in keyboard mode
field.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

register.title: Access Conditions to configuration & firmware update

option.title: The firmware can be upgraded with no restriction through the Local host interface
Authentication using *HostCommAdminKey* is required to upgrade the firmware
Authentication using *HostCommAdminKey* is required to run sensitive instructions
The firmware can be upgraded with no restriction through the Remote host interface
Authentication using *HostCommAdminKey* is required to upgrade the firmware
Authentication using *HostCommAdminKey* is required to run sensitive instructions
The configuration is readable and writable through the Remote console
The configuration is only writable through the Remote console
Authentication using [Admin Password](Admin_Password) is required to gain write access to the configuration
The configuration is locked (no read / no write over the Remote console)
Remote user can authenticate using [Admin Password](Admin_Password)
Remote user can authenticate using [User Password](User_Password)

register.note: Whatever the settings in bits 5-4 of bytes 1 and 2, the registers holding the two passwords (`02FE` and `02FF`) can never be read back, and the [Inventory](../Inventory) and [License](../License) registers (`0200` to `020F`) are always readable. When the "Protect admin key and sensitive registers" bit in bytes 1 (Local) and 2 (Remote) is set, the *HostCommAdminKey* and the registers 02F0 to 02FF (including this Access Conditions register itself) can be changed only after an authentication using *HostCommAdminKey*. If this bit is not set, they are treated as all other configuration entries.

register.title: Failed authentication counters
register.description: Protect the product against brute-force attacks

field.title: Counter to lock the Admin password in case of repeated authentication failures
field.name: Admin
field.remark: Set to 0 to disable password locking

field.title: Counter to lock the User password in case of repeated authentication failures
field.name: User
field.remark: Set to 0 to disable password locking

field.title: Counter to lock the Admin authentication key in case of repeated authentication failures
field.name: Admin
field.remark: Set to 0 to disable password locking

field.title: Counter to lock the User authentication key in case of repeated authentication failures
field.name: User
field.remark: Set to 0 to disable password locking

register.title: Options for Master Card and Config push
register.description: TBD

field.title: Options for Master Card and Config push

register.title: Key ID key for Master Card and Config push
register.description: Master Cards are protected by a key-set, combining AES keys to read the Master Card, and an ECC key-pair to prove the authenticity of its content. This register stores the Key ID that identifies the key-set. The same Key ID is used for Config push.

field.title: Key ID key for Master Card and Config push

register.title: AES auth key for Master Card and Config push
register.description: Master Cards are protected by a key-set, combining AES keys to read the Master Card, and an ECC key-pair to prove the authenticity of its content. This register stores the AES key that protects the data on the card. The same AES key is used for Config push.

field.title: AES auth key for Master Card and Config push

register.title: ECC public key for Master Card and Config push
register.description: Master Cards are protected by a key-set, combining AES keys to read the Master Card, and an ECC key-pair to prove the authenticity of its content. This register stores the public part of the ECC key-pair. The same public key is used for Config push.

field.title: ECC public key for Master Card and Config push

register.title: Address of remote server
register.description: The UDP Sender sends its events to this server
register.remark: Leave empty or set to 255.255.255.255 for broadcast

option.title: Discard frames coming from the wrong port
Accept commands only from the specified remote address

field.title: Control whether Legacy communication drives the UI automatically
field.name: Auto UI

option.title: No automatic UI control, UI shall be controlled explicitly by the host
Automatic UI control, the product signals the host actions on its LEDs

field.title: Number of seconds after which the RF field is switched OFF and the host is reported has missing
field.name: Idle timeout
field.remark: Set to 00 to disable this feature (warning: the RF field may remain ON forever if the host does not switch it OFF itself)

field.title: Select the serial interface driver
field.name: select
field.remark: This feature depends on the underlying hardware. Please refer to the device's detailed datasheet and application notes.
